#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

// Precompute the third part's list.

#define MAX_LI 1000

int li[MAX_LI];

void precompute_li() {

    int temp[4];
    int index =0;

    for (int i=1; i<=370; i++) {

        int num = i;
        int count =0;
        int temp_index =0;

        int p = num;
        while (p !=0) {
            int digit = p%10;
            temp[temp_index++] = digit;
            p = p/10;
            count++;
        }

        if (count ==1) {
            li[index++] = num;
        } else {
            // add digits in order (original order)
            for (int j = temp_index-1; j >=0; j--) {
                li[index++] = temp[j];
            }
        }
    }

    // After all i, the index is 1002. Need to remove last two elements.
    // So the final array is up to index-2 (since 1002-2=1000 elements)
    // So the array is li[0 ... 999]
}

int main() {

    precompute_li();

    // Read first program's inputs.

    int princess, dragon, t, f, c;
    scanf("%d %d %d %d %d", &princess, &dragon, &t, &f, &c);

    int first_result;

    if (dragon <= princess) {
        first_result =0;
    } else {
        double position = t * princess;
        position += (princess * position) / (dragon - princess);

        int result =0;
        while (position < c) {
            result++;
            double temp = (princess * position)/dragon;
            position += temp;
            position += princess * f;
            temp = (princess * position)/(dragon - princess);
            position += temp;
        }
        first_result = result;
    }

    // Now, process second program with first_result as input.

    // Convert first_result to a string.

    char first_str[20];
    sprintf(first_str, "%d", first_result);

    int mod = 1e9 +7;
    int n = strlen(first_str);

    // Initialize DP array.

    int dp[n+1][2];
    memset(dp, 0, sizeof(dp));
    dp[0][0] =1;

    for (int i=0; i <n; i++) {
        char c = first_str[i];
        if (c == '0') {
            dp[i+1][0] = (dp[i+1][0] + dp[i][0]) % mod;
            dp[i+1][1] = (dp[i+1][1] + (long long)dp[i][1] *3) % mod;
        } else {
            dp[i+1][0] = (dp[i+1][0] + (long long)dp[i][0] *2) % mod;
            dp[i+1][1] = (dp[i+1][1] + dp[i][0]) % mod;
            dp[i+1][1] = (dp[i+1][1] + (long long)dp[i][1] *3) % mod;
        }
    }

    int second_result = (dp[n][0] + dp[n][1]) % mod;

    // Now, third step: get n from second_result.

    int n_third = second_result;

    // The third's output is li[n_third -1]

    printf("%d\n", li[n_third -1]);

    return 0;
}
